We have just described one concept of "group
learning" through the television medium. A group
of students, with a teacher, on television,
working in the same subject area as another group
of students in a classroom setting, at the same
rate of speed and with the same materials.
We know, that to use this technique effectively,
there are some ground rules that are useful to
know:
1) Both teachers must teach the same
way, using the same method.
2) There must be communication between
the two teachers, in the preparatory
and on-going phases of the experience.
